result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony K Clay

defendant.name: Clay, Anthony K
defendant.address: 1747 Rose St Lot 77, La Crosse, WI 54603

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Anthony K Clay
Current: 1747 Rose St Lot 77, La Crosse, WI 54603 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2015)
Prior: 1121 10th Street South, La Crosse, WI 54601
Christopher Zachar

State by Kellis / Def w/ Atty Allan Beatty
Def plead & sentenced in 14CF420
THIS CASE IS DISMISSED & READ-IN
**CASH BOND ON FILE IS APPLIED TO FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS IN 14CF420**
Bond in 14CF420 to cover 14cF260 also
taken off calendar
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 9, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial on August 28, 2014 at 08:45 am.

3:16 PM - Def in court w/Atty Allan E Beatty.  Emily E Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Beatty: this is set for trial and he's been on EM and I request that it be discontinued. It's the expense and inconvenience
Hynek: monitoring is the only way of ensuring her safety at this time. 
Crt:  COMPAS shows....  I modified the bond to allow 3rd party contact f/ child care and for him to be in the home as long as she's not in the home and given the COMPAS and the allegations it strikes an approp balance. 
Beatty: she has requested that all of the contact restrictions be lifted and she would like that to happen
Crt: I realize that. But I am not prepared to let him back in the house
Beatty: I don't know about their relationship but it would make it easier.
Crt: I have tried to strike a balance but there are concerns w/ the COMPAS and the allegations in the complaint and that's as far as I am prepared to go at this point.
Jury trial on August 28, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Anthony K Clay not in court.  Michelle A Keller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim present
Keller: he has other charges like this.  Wouldn't object to modification to provide child care and no objection to 3rd party contact f/ child care issues.
Victim: I just need more care. 
Crt: I don't want you in the house together. 
BOND MODIFIED: I will allow 3rd party contact for child care and he will be allowed to have contact w/ the children in the residence so long as Victim isn't in the residence.(for example, she can be leaving the house and he can be coming into the house so long as it's an outside passing)

Jamie S has not met w/the Victim Witness Coordinator, left 2 - 3 messages.
CRT: Stop by the DA's Office if you want the No Contact to be lifted, they will set a hearing.

to SLH from Jamie S. re: would like the no contact lifted, would like Anthony to watch their 7 kids for the weekend.
Filed

11:38 AM - Defendant Anthony K Clay not in court.  Crystal L Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Crt: this was for LNC and there is a NC and removed from the calendar
COMPAS report

Sworn testimony from Officer Brooke Privet
Probable cause found - boundover for trial
Information filed 
Def stands mute - NG plea entered
Status: 06-12-14 at 10:00am w/SLH
Same bond and conditions

From the Victim Jamie S. re: The defendant was not stalking her, he just wanted his truck and she over reacted.  She does not want him to be in any trouble and wants the no contact lifted so he can come home. Filed
Allan Beatty

Bond already on file will continue.
Defendant waives PH time limits
Beatty requests Sig Bond
CRT: Cash bond posted to remain at this time.
PH: 04-25-14 at 11:00am w/SLH
Initial continued to 04-10-14

Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination filed
$500.00 Cash Bond required w/cond: No Contact with Jamie S. or the address listed or her employment.
Referred to JS
Comply with JS conditions - GPS with exclusion zone.
Initial: 04-03-14 at 1:30pm
